p: Tshitenge et al. investigated the anti-malarial constituents of the medicinal plant-based SIROP KILMA, with constitutive plants composed from Gardenia ternifolia (Rubiaceae), Crossopteryx febrifuga (Rubiaceae), and Lantana camara (Verbenaceae) [ 26]. The authors identified two flavonoid glycosides; stachannin ( 52) and pectolinarigenin-7- O-glucoside ( 53) [ 26]. The flavone glycoside morreloflavone-7 - O -glucoside ( 54) was isolated by Azebaze et al. from Allanblackia floribunda (Guttiferae), harvested in Cameroon. This compound presented antiplasmodial activities against the F32 and FcM29 strains with IC 50 values of 15.98 and 11.69 µM; 40.36 and 33.24 µM at 24 h and 72 h, respectively [ 78].
